actions.text: Fill small bowl with water
Remove leafstalks from 1 sprigs of fresh coriander
Peel 2 mangoes with peeler and cut into cubes of 2 centimeters side length
Place mango cubes into empty medium-sized bowl
Peel 1 large red onion and slice into slices of 2 milimeters thickness
Place onion slices into small bowl with water
Keep onions in small bowl for 10 minutes
Finely chop coriander
Add coriander to medium-sized bowl with mangoes
Cut 1 fresh chili pepper into halves lengthwise
Remove seeds from chili peppers with knife point
Slice chili peppers into slices of 2 milimeters width
Add chili pepper slices and 0.25 teaspoons of salt to medium-sized bowl with mangoes
Cut 4 limes into halves
Squeeze limes out with lemon squeezer into medium-sized bowl with mangoes
Drain onions
Add drained onions to mango ceviche and stir gently
Place ceviche into fridge
Keep ceviche in fridge for 5 minutes
Place 240 grams basmati rice into sieve
Rinse rice with cold running water until water runs clear
Drain rice
Add 520 milliliters water to medium-sized saucepan and bring to the boil
Add drained rice and 1 pinches of salt to saucepan
Cover saucepan with lid and cook on lowest heat for 20 minutes
Rinse 240 grams quinoa in sieve with cold running water
Drain quinoa
Place quinoa into medium-sized saucepan
Add 600 milliliters water into saucepan to cover content
Cover saucepan with lid
Bring water to the boil over medium heat
Stir quinoa
Cover saucepan with lid and cook on lowest heat for 15 minutes
Rinse cooked quinoa in sieve with cold water
Drain quinoa
Heat 1 tablespoons of olive oil in medium-sized frying pan until hot
Add quinoa to frying pan and saut for 5 minutes
Rinse 230 grams fresh spinach leaves with water
Dry spinach with salad spinner
Evenly spread spinach leaves on serving platter
Wash 2 fresh tomatoes and cut into small pieces
Evenly spread tomato pieces on spinach
Cut 2 avocados into halves
Remove stones from avocados
Peel avocados and cut into small pieces
Evenly spread avocado pieces on tomatoes and spinach
Peel 1 shallot and chop finely
Evenly spread chopped shallots on salad
Cut 6 precooked beetroots into thin slices
Evenly spread beetroot slices on salad
Add 1 tablespoons of dijon mustard, 120 milliliters olive oil and 120 milliliters balsamic vinegar to small bowl
Whisk mustard, oil and vinegar until well combined
Crumble 100 grams feta
Top salad with crumbled feta
Pour oil vinegar dressing over beetroot avocado salad
Wash 1 heads of broccoli with cold water
Cut off florets from broccoli
Preheat oven to 230 degrees celsius
Add broccoli florets and 3 tablespoons of olive oil to medium-sized bowl
Season broccoli with 1 pinches of ground pepper and 1 pinches of salt
Line baking tray with baking parchment
Mix broccoli, spices and oil until well combined
Scatter broccoli evenly across baking tray
Bake broccoli in the pre-heated oven at 230 degrees celsius for 15 minutes
Peel 2 cloves of fresh garlic and chop roughly
Cut 1 fresh chili pepper into halves lengthwise
Remove seeds from chili peppers with knife point
Roughly chop chili peppers
Peel 2 centimeters fresh ginger and chop roughly
Wash 1 stalks of fresh lemongrass
Cut off bottom from lemongrass
Smash lemongrass with rolling pin
Peel 500 grams sweet potatoes and chop roughly
Wash 20 grams fresh coriander
Separate leaves of coriander from stems
Add 1 teaspoons of olive oil to large saucepan and heat-up until hot
Chop coriander stems
Add chopped garlic, chopped chili peppers and chopped ginger to saucepan
Add smashed lemongrass, chopped coriander stems and 2 tablespoons of red curry paste to saucepan
Cook spices on lowest heat for 2.5 minutes
Prepare 750 milliliters chicken stock according to instructions on packaging
Add chicken stock, 160 milliliters coconut cream and chopped sweet potatoes to saucepan
Cook sweet potato soup on medium heat for 15 minutes
Cut 2 chicken breasts into slices of 0.5 centimeter thickness
Remove lemongrass from soup
Transfer soup to blender and blend until smooth
Transfer soup to saucepan
Add chicken to saucepan
Cook chicken and sweet potato soup on medium heat for 10 minutes
Chop coriander leaves
Squeeze 1 lime out into saucepan
Add 1 teaspoons of white sugar and 0.5 teaspoons of fish sauce to saucepan
Gently stir chicken and sweet potato soup
Scatter coriander leaves across chicken and sweet potato soup
Preheat oven to 220 degrees celsius
Peel 300 grams carrots and cut into pieces of 3 centimeters length
Place carrot pieces on large rectangular baking tray
Peel 500 grams sweet potatoes and cut into pieces of 3 centimeters thickness
Place sweet potatoes on baking tray
Drizzle 2 tablespoons of olive oil over sweet potatoes and carrots
Season sweet potatoes and carrots with 2 pinches of salt
Bake sweet potatoes and carrots in the oven at 220 degrees celsius for 30 minutes
Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil to large saucepan
Peel 2 fresh onions
Roughly dice onions into pieces of 0.5 centimeter thickness
Heat-up olive oil until hot
Add onion dice to saucepan
Fry onions on lowest heat for 10 minutes
Peel 2 cloves of fresh garlic
Roughly dice garlic into pieces of 0.5 centimeter thickness
Add garlic dice to saucepan and stir
Add 1 liters vegetable stock to saucepan
Simmer vegetable stock on medium heat for 8 minutes
Set saucepan aside
Add sweet potatoes and carrots to saucepan and blend until smooth
Add 100 milliliters crme frache to saucepan and heat until hot
Cut 280 grams sushi grade flounder filets into dice of 1 centimeter side length
Place flounder dice into sieve
Rinse flounder with cold water, drain and pat dry with kitchen papers
Cut 1 fresh chili pepper into halves lengthwise
Cut 3 limes into halves
Squeeze lime halves into medium-sized bowl
Add flounder dice to bowl
Mix fish and juice until well combined
Marinate flounder dice for 2.5 minutes in bowl
Remove seeds from chili peppers with knife point
Slice chili pepper halves into thin slices of 0.25 centimeters thickness
Add chili pepper slices to bowl
Peel 1 shallot and cut into quarters
Slice shallot quarters into thin slices of 0.25 centimeters thickness
Add shallot slices to bowl
Season flounder ceviche with 1 pinches of salt
Mix ceviche until well combined
Peel 5 cloves of fresh garlic
Peel 1 fresh onion and chop finely
Wash 1 red pepper and chop finely
Add 75 milliliters olive oil to large saucepan and heat-up until hot
Add 600 grams minced beef to saucepan
Fry minced beef on high heat until golden
Finely chop garlic
Add 1 teaspoons of ground cumin, 0.25 tablespoons of dried oregano and 1 dried bay leaf to minced beef
Add chopped onions, chopped garlic and chopped peppers to minced beef
Cook minced beef, vegetables and spices on medium heat for 10 minutes
Cut 100 grams green olives into halves
Add olives, 2.5 deciliters white cooking wine and 1 tablespoons of tomato paste to minced beef
Open 400 grams canned tomatoes with can opener
Add tomatoes and 40 grams raisins to minced beef
Cook minced beef with sauce on low heat for 30 minutes
Season Picadillo Cubano with 1 pinches of salt and 1 pinches of ground pepper
Rinse 400 grams canned chickpeas in sieve with cold running water
Peel 1 shallot and cut into thin slices
Add 2 tablespoons of olive oil to large frying pan and heat-up until hot
Add shallot slices to frying pan and saut for 5 minutes
Pat chickpeas dry with kitchen papers
Add dried chickpeas to frying pan
Sprinkle 1 pinches of salt over chickpeas
Cook chickpeas and shallots on medium heat for 2 minutes
Add 1 teaspoons of white wine vinegar to frying pan
Cook mix on medium heat for 1 minute
Peel 3 potatoes
Peel 1 fresh onion and chop
Peel 1 cloves of fresh garlic and mince
Add 2 tablespoons of coconut oil to large saucepan
Heat-up coconut oil until liquid
Add chopped onions and minced garlic to saucepan
Cook onions and garlic on medium heat for 1 minute
Add 450 grams minced beef to saucepan
Fry minced beef on medium heat until cooked through
Open 560 grams canned tomatoes
Cut potatoes into small cubes
Add 1.5 teaspoons of yellow curry powder, 2.25 teaspoons of salt and 0.75 teaspoons of ground pepper to saucepan
Add 0.75 teaspoons of ground cinnamon, 0.75 teaspoons of ground ginger and 0.75 teaspoons of ground curcuma to saucepan
Add potato cubes, tomatoes and 400 grams frozen peas to saucepan
Bring beef curry to the boil
Cover saucepan with lid and simmer for 25 minutes
Add 190 grams walnut halves to medium-sized frying pan and roast on medium heat until golden brown
Cut 600 grams chicken breasts into small dice
Add 1 teaspoons of olive oil to empty large frying pan and heat over medium heat until hot
Add chicken to large frying pan
Season chicken with 1 teaspoons of salt
Fry chicken on medium heat until browned
Let walnut halves cool down for 5 minutes
Transfer walnut halves to blender and blend until finely ground
Peel 1 fresh onion and cut into small dice
Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil to large saucepan and heat-up until hot
Add onion dice to saucepan and saut until soft
Prepare 470 milliliters chicken stock according to instructions on packaging
Transfer chicken to saucepan
Add chicken stock to saucepan and bring to the boil over medium heat
Add 50 milliliters pomegranate molasses, 2 tablespoons of honey and 0.25 teaspoons of ground cinnamon to saucepan
Add 0.25 teaspoons of ground nutmeg, 1 pinches of ground pepper and 0.5 teaspoons of ground curcuma to saucepan
Add ground walnut halves to saucepan and stir gently
Cover saucepan with lid and simmer on medium heat for 25 minutes
Wash 10 grams fresh coriander and chop roughly
Roughly cut 0.5 pomegranate into quarters
Scrape seeds out of pomegranates
Sprinkle coriander and pomegranate seeds over fesenjan
Add 200 grams plain curd to large bowl
Roughly cut 500 grams lamb fillets into large pieces of 10 centimeters thickness
Transfer lamb to bowl
Peel 3 cloves of fresh garlic
Finely grate garlic into bowl
Peel 5 centimeters fresh ginger with peeler
Finely grate ginger into bowl
Add 2 teaspoons of ground coriander, 2 teaspoons of garam masala and 1 teaspoons of chili powder to bowl
Add 1 teaspoons of ground curcuma, 1 teaspoons of ground cumin and 1.5 teaspoons of salt to bowl
Mix curd, lamb and spices until well combined
Marinate lamb for 2 hours in bowl
Transfer marinated fillet pieces to large frying pan
Cook lamb on medium heat for 3 minutes
Add 2 tablespoons of ghee to frying pan
Cook lamb on medium heat until browned
Add 300 milliliters water to frying pan
Bring water to the boil over lowest heat
Cook lamb on lowest heat until cooked through
Finely chop 1 handfuls of fresh coriander
Garnish lamb with chopped fresh coriander
Add 1 teaspoons of raisins to blender
Cut 1 orange into halves
Juice orange halves
Add orange juice to blender
Wash 200 grams apples gently with cold water and peel
Roughly cut apples into small cubes
Transfer apple cubes to blender and blend until smooth
Transfer blended fruits to small frying pan
Gently heat fruit mix over medium heat until hot
Add 1 tablespoons of white sugar to frying pan
Gently stir in 0.5 teaspoons of salt into apple raisin marinade
Cook marinade on medium heat until thick
Turn hotplate off
Add 500 grams lamb chops to frying pan
Marinate chops for 2 hours in marinade
Add 2 tablespoons of olive oil and marinated chops to empty large frying pan
Gently heat olive oil in large frying pan over medium heat until hot
Cook chops on medium heat for 10 minutes
Turn chops around
Cook marinated chops on medium heat for 10 minutes
Wash 0.5 green pepper
Slice pepper into thin stripes
Add pepper stripes to medium-sized bowl
Wash 0.5 yellow pepper
Slice yellow pepper into thin stripes
Add yellow pepper stripes to bowl
Wash 0.5 red pepper
Slice red pepper into thin stripes
Add red pepper stripes to bowl
Wash 1 fresh chili pepper
Thinly slice chili pepper
Add chili pepper slices to bowl
Drizzle 1 tablespoons of apple vinegar over peppers
Season peppers gently with 0.25 teaspoons of salt
Mix three pepper salad until well combined
Open 400 grams condensed milk with can opener
Break 150 grams dark chocolate into small pieces
Add 150 grams butter to medium-sized saucepan
Melt butter on low heat
Add dark chocolate pieces to saucepan
Turn hotplate off
Mix chocolate and butter with cooking spoon until homogeneous
Add condensed milk to saucepan
Mix chocolate and condensed milk with cooking spoon until homogeneous
Turn hotplate on
Cook chocolate mixture on low heat for 10 minutes
Stir chocolate mixture every 30 seconds
Transfer chocolate mixture to medium-sized bowl
Cool chocolate mixture in fridge for 40 minutes
Add 200 grams chocolate sprinkles to empty small bowl
Form chocolate mixture into small balls
Coat chocolate balls generously with chocolate sprinkles
Wash 0.5 small cucumber gently with cold water and peel
Finely chop cucumber
Add 400 grams plain curd to large bowl
Whisk plain curd for 2 minutes
Add chopped cucumbers to bowl
Wash 0.25 small carrot carefully with cold water and peel
Finely grate carrot
Add grated carrots to bowl
Peel 0.5 small red onion and chop finely
Add chopped onions to bowl
Wash 0.5 small fresh tomato carefully with cold water and chop finely
Add chopped tomatoes to bowl
Wash 15 leaves of fresh mint carefully with cold water and chop finely
Add chopped mint leaves, 1.5 teaspoons of salt and 0.5 teaspoons of ground pepper to bowl
Add 1.5 teaspoons of ground cumin to bowl and stir gently until well combined
Add 50 grams breadcrumbs, 100 grams grated parmesan and 1 tablespoons of dried basil to large bowl
Add 0.5 teaspoons of ground pepper to bowl
Mix breadcrumbs, cheese, basil and black pepper with fork until well combined
Add 1 tablespoons of olive oil to empty medium-sized bowl
Peel 5 cloves of fresh garlic
Finely grate garlic into medium-sized bowl with olive oil
Mix garlic and oil with fork until well combined
Clean 2 large chicken breasts gently with cold water
Pat chicken dry with kitchen papers
Coat chicken evenly with garlic and oil marinade
Preheat oven to 200 degrees celsius
Coat chicken generously with breadcrumb mix
Grease baking tray with 0.5 tablespoon of olive oil
Place chicken on baking tray
Bake chicken in the pre-heated oven at 200 degrees celsius for 15 minutes
Place 2 large chicken breasts in medium-sized bowl
Pour 1 teaspoons of olive oil gently over chicken
Sprinkle 0.5 teaspoons of ground pepper and 0.5 teaspoons of salt over chicken
Mix chicken and spices until well combined
Gently heat 0.5 teaspoon of olive oil in large frying pan over medium heat until hot
Transfer chicken to frying pan
Cook chicken on medium heat until golden brown
Turn chicken around
Cook chicken on medium heat until golden brown
Peel 1 small fresh onion with knife and chop finely
Transfer chicken to large round baking tray
Add chopped onions, 200 milliliters chicken stock and 0.5 teaspoon of salt to frying pan
Preheat oven to 250 degrees celsius
Add 0.5 teaspoons of chili pepper flakes and 1 tablespoons of lemon juice to frying pan
Boil chicken broth sauce on medium heat for 4 minutes
Add 100 milliliters whipping cream and 0.5 tablespoons of butter to sauce
Bring sauce to the boil over medium heat
Pour cream sauce gently over chicken
Bake chicken in the oven at 180 degrees celsius for 10 minutes
Put 500 grams lamb chops into large bowl
Season chops with 0.5 teaspoons of salt and 0.5 teaspoons of ground pepper
Sprinkle 0.5 teaspoons of dried basil and 1 teaspoons of dried rosemary evenly over chops
Mix chops and spices until well combined
Marinate seasoned chops for 15 minutes in bowl
Add 1 tablespoons of olive oil to large frying pan and heat gently over medium heat until hot
Add chops to frying pan
Cook chops on high heat for 3 minutes
Turn chops around
Cook chops on high heat for 3 minutes
Peel 1 small fresh onion with knife and chop finely
Place chops in casserole dish
Cover casserole dish with aluminium foil
Add chopped onions to frying pan and saut on medium heat for 2 minutes
Pour 125 milliliters chicken stock gently over onions
Pour 200 milliliters balsamic vinegar gently over onions
Boil sauce on medium heat for 5 minutes
Add 1 tablespoons of salted butter to sauce
Remove aluminium foil gently from casserole dish
Pour balsamic sauce gently over chops
Add 1 pinches of salt and 600 milliliters water to medium-sized saucepan
Rinse 170 grams quinoa in sieve with cold running water until water runs clear
Drain quinoa
Add quinoa to saucepan and stir
Cover saucepan with lid
Bring water to the boil over medium heat
Stir quinoa
Cover saucepan with lid and cook on low heat for 15 minutes
Turn hotplate off
Stir quinoa for 30 seconds
Transfer quinoa to large bowl
Cool quinoa in fridge for 15 minutes
Wash 400 grams strawberries with cold water
Remove stems from strawberries with knife
Finely cut strawberries into quarters
Add strawberries to quinoa
Wash 300 grams blueberries with cold water
Add blueberries to quinoa
Wash 2 sprigs of fresh mint with cold water
Separate leaves of mint from leafstalks
Finely chop mint leaves
Wash 1 lime with cold water and cut into halves
Squeeze limes into empty medium-sized bowl
Add 3 tablespoons of honey and chopped mint to lime juice
Mix honey lime dressing until well combined
Wash 1 mango with cold water and peel with peeler
Cut mango into small pieces
Add mangoes to quinoa
Drizzle honey lime dressing over quinoa
Mix quinoa, fruits and dressing with cooking spoon until well combined

groupsArr.title: Quinoa Fruit Salad with Honey Lime Dressing

name: Quinoa Fruit Salad with Honey Lime Dressing

actions.text: Add 7 deciliters water, 300 grams ice cubes and 1 teaspoons of salt to large bowl
Mix salt and water until well combined
Peel 1 red onion and slice finely
Add onion slices to salted water
Soak onions in salted water for 30 minutes
Cut 1 lemon into halves
Juice lemons
Add lemon juice to empty medium-sized bowl
Wash 1 fresh chili pepper with cold water and cut into halves lengthwise
Scrape seeds out of chili peppers
Finely chop chili pepper halves
Add chopped chili peppers, 1 pinch of salt and 1 pinches of ground pepper to lemon juice
Add 1 tablespoons of olive oil to lemon juice
Drain onion slices with sieve
Rinse onions with cold running water
Add onion slices to dressing
Mix red onion salad until well combined
Let salad rest for 1 hour
Preheat oven to 200 degrees celsius
Add 450 grams minced lamb to large bowl
Peel 0.5 red onion and chop finely
Add chopped onions to bowl
Peel 2 cloves of fresh garlic and chop finely
Add chopped garlic to bowl
Peel 50 grams fresh ginger
Finely grate ginger into bowl
Add 30 grams breadcrumbs to bowl
Wash 20 grams fresh parsley with cold water and chop
Add chopped parsley to bowl
Wash 10 grams fresh coriander with cold water and chop finely
Add chopped coriander to bowl
Wash 1 lemon with cold water
Dry lemon with towel
Zest lemon into bowl
Add 70 grams pine nuts to bowl
Crumble 150 grams feta into bowl
Add 1 teaspoons of salt, 0.5 teaspoons of ground pepper and 1 teaspoons of ground cardamom to bowl
Add 1 teaspoons of ground cinnamon to bowl
Add 1 chicken egg to empty small bowl
Beat egg until frothy
Add egg to large bowl with minced lamb
Mix content of large bowl until well combined
Form meat into small balls
Place meatballs on baking parchment
Heat 5 tablespoons of olive oil in large frying pan over high heat until hot
Add meatballs to frying pan
Stir-fry meatballs on high heat for 2 minutes
Turn meatballs
Stir-fry meatballs on high heat for 1 minute
Grease large rectangular baking tray evenly with 1 tablespoon of olive oil
Place meatballs on baking tray
Transfer meatballs to oven
Bake meatballs in the oven at 200 degrees celsius for 12 minutes
Add 80 grams tahini, 4 tablespoons of water and 0.5 teaspoon of salt to empty medium-sized bowl
Cut zested lemon into halves
Juice lemons
Add lemon juice to medium-sized bowl
Whisk sauce until well combined
Take meatballs out of oven
Transfer meatballs to serving platter
Pour sauce over meatballs
Preheat oven to 220 degrees celsius
Grease small round baking tray lightly with 0.5 tablespoons of olive oil
Wash 6 small potatoes firmly with cold water
Add potatoes to baking tray
Drizzle 1 tablespoon of olive oil over potatoes
Season potatoes with 0.5 teaspoons of salt and 0.5 teaspoons of ground pepper
Bake potatoes in the oven at 220 degrees celsius for 20 minutes
Add 3 tablespoons of frozen peas, 0.5 teaspoon of pepper and 0.75 teaspoon of salt to blender
Add 4 tablespoons of olive oil and 3 tablespoons of lemon juice to blender
Wash 15 grams fresh coriander gently with cold water
Add coriander to blender
Wash 15 grams fresh mint gently with cold water
Separate leaves of mint from leafstalks
Add mint leaves to blender and blend on high Level until well blended
Remove potatoes carefully from oven
Roughly cut baked potatoes into halves
Transfer potato halves to serving platter
Pour herb sauce lightly over potatoes
Rinse 200 grams fresh spinach leaves firmly with cold running water
Drain spinach with sieve
Peel 4 cloves of fresh garlic with knife
Wash 1 small fresh ginger firmly with cold water and peel
Finely grate ginger
Add 1 tablespoons of sesame oil to small frying pan and heat carefully over high heat until hot
Finely grate garlic
Add ginger and garlic to frying pan
Lightly stir ginger and garlic for 1 minute
Add spinach to ginger and garlic
Stir-fry spinach with spatula on high heat for 1 minute
Season spinach lightly with 2 pinches of salt
Stir-fry spinach with spatula on high heat for 30 seconds
Transfer spinach to serving platter
Sprinkle 1 tablespoons of sesame seeds evenly over spinach
Preheat oven to 200 degrees celsius
Wash 4 small carrots firmly with cold water and peel with peeler
Roughly cut peeled carrots into halves lengthwise
Transfer carrot halves to small casserole dish
Drizzle 0.5 tablespoons of olive oil evenly over carrots
Bake casserole dish in the pre-heated oven at 200 degrees celsius for 20 minutes
Remove casserole dish carefully from oven
Season baked carrots with 1 pinches of salt and 0.25 teaspoons of powdered garlic
Sprinkle 0.25 teaspoons of dried basil and 0.25 teaspoons of dried rosemary evenly over carrots
Drizzle 1 tablespoons of lemon juice evenly over carrots
Mix content of casserole dish with spatula until well combined
Peel 0.5 large fresh onion
Add 1 tablespoons of olive oil to medium-sized frying pan and heat gently over high heat until hot
Finely chop onion
Add chopped onions to frying pan
Cook onions on high heat for 1 minute
Add 1.5 tablespoons of wheat flour to frying pan and stir firmly for 1 minute
Add 0.25 teaspoons of salt and 1 cheese slice to frying pan
Rinse 250 grams fresh spinach leaves gently with cold running water
Drain spinach leaves with sieve
Add spinach to frying pan
Pour 400 milliliters whole milk gently over spinach
Vigorously stir sauce and spinach for 1 minute
Cook sauce on high heat until thick
Sprinkle 1 pinches of ground nutmeg evenly over spinach
Rinse 240 grams quinoa in sieve with cold running water
Drain quinoa
Add quinoa to medium-sized saucepan
Add 600 milliliters water into saucepan to cover content
Cover saucepan with lid
Bring water to the boil over medium heat
Stir quinoa
Cover saucepan with lid and cook on low heat for 15 minutes
Rinse quinoa in sieve with cold running water
Drain quinoa
Heat 1 tablespoons of olive oil in large frying pan until hot
Add quinoa to frying pan and saut on medium heat for 5 minutes
Peel 200 grams kohlrabis and slice finely
Peel 50 grams pearl onions
Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in empty medium-sized frying pan until hot
Add onions to medium-sized frying pan and saut on medium heat until golden brown
Remove quinoa from hotplate
Add kohlrabi slices and 20 grams capers to medium-sized frying pan
Remove vegetables from hotplate
Wash 10 grams fresh coriander with cold water
Separate leaves of coriander from leafstalks
Finely chop coriander leaves
Wash 10 grams fresh parsley with cold water
Separate leaves of parsley from leafstalks
Finely chop parsley leaves
Peel 20 grams fresh ginger with knife
Grate ginger
Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in saucepan until hot
Add ginger to hot olive oil and saut on medium heat for 20 seconds
Add quinoa and vegetables to sauted ginger
Season quinoa and vegetables with 0.5 teaspoons of ground pepper and 0.5 teaspoons of salt
Stir in chopped coriander into quinoa and vegetables
Stir in chopped parsley into quinoa and vegetables
Mix quinoa, vegetables and herbs until well combined
Wash 1 small apple firmly with cold water and peel
Roughly grate apple into medium-sized bowl
Add 100 grams yoghurt to bowl
Sprinkle 0.25 teaspoons of ground pepper evenly over yoghurt
Add 0.5 tablespoons of raisins and 1.5 tablespoons of white wine vinegar to bowl
Wash 5 grams fresh coriander gently with cold water and chop finely
Add chopped coriander to bowl
Season yoghurt gently with 0.5 teaspoons of salt
Wash 2 small carrots firmly with cold water and peel
Finely grate carrots into bowl
Mix carrot salad until well combined
Cool salad in fridge for 15 minutes
Preheat oven to 200 degrees celsius
Wash 3 small carrots firmly with cold water and peel
Roughly cut carrots into big pieces
Place carrots on small round baking tray
Season carrots lightly with 0.5 teaspoons of salt
Sprinkle 0.25 teaspoons of dried rosemary evenly over carrots
Drizzle 1 tablespoons of olive oil evenly over carrots
Mix carrots and spices until well combined
Bake carrots in the oven at 200 degrees celsius for 20 minutes
Preheat oven to 180 degrees celsius
Wash 4 small potatoes firmly with cold water
Prick potatoes well with knife point
Place potatoes on small round baking tray
Season potatoes lightly with 0.5 teaspoons of salt
Drizzle 1.5 tablespoons of olive oil generously over potatoes
Mix potatoes, salt and oil until well combined
Bake potatoes in the oven at 180 degrees celsius for 90 minutes
Roughly score baked potatoes with knife
Stuff 3 tablespoons of grated cheddar into baked potatoes
Wash 1 cucumber firmly with cold water and peel
Roughly cut cucumber into thin slices
Add cucumber slices to medium-sized bowl
Pour 1 tablespoons of white wine vinegar gently over cucumber slices
Season cucumber slices with 0.5 teaspoons of salt and 0.25 teaspoons of ground pepper
Sprinkle 0.5 teaspoons of dried rosemary evenly over cucumber slices
Drizzle 1 tablespoons of olive oil generously over cucumber slices
Peel 1 red onion and cut finely into thin slices
Transfer onion slices to bowl
Mix cucumber and onion salad until well combined
Cool salad in fridge for 10 minutes
Wash 2 large potatoes firmly with cold water and peel with peeler
Finely cut potatoes into large sticks
Preheat oven to 220 degrees celsius
Line baking tray with baking parchment
Transfer potatoes to baking tray
Drizzle 2.5 tablespoons of olive oil generously over potatoes
Mix potatoes and oil until well combined
Bake potatoes in the oven at 220 degrees celsius for 25 minutes
Transfer baked potatoes to serving platter
Season baked potatoes lightly with 0.75 teaspoons of salt
Add 250 milliliters water and 0.5 teaspoons of salt to medium-sized saucepan
Wash 130 grams fresh green beans carefully with cold water
Trim green beans with knife
Roughly cut green beans into halves
Add green beans to saucepan
Boil green beans on high heat for 4 minutes
Peel 1 small red onion and chop finely
Drain green beans with sieve
Cool green beans at room temperature for 5 minutes
Add chopped onions to large bowl
Wash 1 sprigs of fresh basil gently with cold water
Separate leaves of basil from leafstalks
Finely chop basil leaves
Add chopped basil to bowl
Add green beans to bowl
Season green beans with 0.5 teaspoon of salt and 0.25 teaspoons of ground pepper
Add 2 tablespoons of olive oil, 1 tablespoons of balsamic vinegar and 50 grams grated parmesan to green beans
Mix green bean salad until well combined
Cool salad in fridge for 10 minutes
Add 250 milliliters water to medium-sized saucepan
Wash 200 grams potatoes firmly with cold water and peel
Finely cut potatoes into small dice
Transfer potatoes to saucepan
Boil potatoes on high heat for 10 minutes
Add 200 milliliters water and 2 chicken eggs to empty small saucepan
Boil eggs on medium heat for 10 minutes
Drain potatoes with sieve
Cool potatoes for 5 minutes
Add boiled potatoes to large bowl
Sprinkle 0.25 teaspoons of ground pepper evenly over potatoes
Season potatoes with 1.5 teaspoons of white sugar and 0.5 teaspoons of salt
Drizzle 1 tablespoons of apple vinegar evenly over potatoes
Add 75 grams mayonnaise to potatoes
Peel boiled eggs and chop roughly
Add chopped eggs to bowl
Wash 1 stalks of celery carefully with cold water and cut finely into small slices
Add celery slices to bowl
Peel 1 small red onion and chop finely
Add chopped onions to bowl
Mix potato salad until well combined
Cool salad in fridge for 10 minutes
Peel 2 sweet potatoes with peeler and cut into cubes
Wash 1 fresh green chili pepper with cold water and cut into halves lengthwise
Remove seeds from chili peppers
Peel 1 fresh onion
Add 1 tablespoons of sunflower oil to large saucepan and heat-up until hot
Add 250 grams minced beef to saucepan
Saut minced beef in saucepan on medium heat for 3 minutes
Chop onion
Finely chop chili peppers
Add chopped onions and chopped chili peppers to saucepan
Mix minced beef, chili peppers and onions with cooking spoon until well combined
Cook minced beef on low heat for 8 minutes
Add sweet potatoes, 0.25 teaspoons of salt and 0.25 teaspoons of ground pepper to saucepan
Peel 1 cloves of fresh garlic with knife and mince
Add minced garlic, 0.5 teaspoons of ground cumin and 0.5 teaspoons of ground coriander to saucepan
Add 1 teaspoons of chili powder to saucepan
Mix minced beef, sweet potatoes and spices with cooking spoon until well combined
Cook content of saucepan on medium heat for 5 minutes
Open 400 grams canned tomatoes with can opener
Add tomatoes to saucepan
Open 435 grams canned black beans with can opener
Add black beans and 125 milimeters beer to saucepan
Mix Chili with cooking spoon until well combined
Bring Chili to the boil over medium heat
Simmer Chili on medium heat for 20 minutes
Stir Chili
Simmer Chili on medium heat for 5 minutes
Preheat oven to 200 degrees celsius
Wash 1 heads of cauliflower
Cut off florets from cauliflower
Add cauliflower florets to large bowl
Peel 3 cloves of fresh garlic and mince
Toss garlic with cauliflower
Drizzle 1 tablespoons of lemon juice and 2 tablespoons of olive oil over cauliflower
Mix seasoned cauliflower until well combined
Line baking tray with baking parchment
Evenly spread cauliflower florets on baking tray
Season cauliflower with 2 pinches of ground pepper and 2 pinches of salt
Bake cauliflower in the pre-heated oven at 200 degrees celsius for 30 minutes
Wash 1 small potato gently with cold water and peel
Peel 0.5 small onion and chop roughly
Wash 1 heads of broccoli gently with cold water
Add 1 teaspoons of olive oil to medium-sized saucepan and heat carefully over high heat until hot
Add onions to hot olive oil
Saut onions on high heat until soft
Roughly chop potato
Roughly cut broccoli into medium-sized pieces
Add potatoes and broccoli to sauted onions
Saut onions, potatoes and broccoli on medium heat for 2 minutes
Prepare 350 milliliters chicken stock according to instructions on packaging
Pour chicken stock gently over sauteed vegetables
Pour 150 milliliters milk gently over sauteed vegetables
Boil milk and stock mixture on high heat for 2 minutes
Cook broccoli soup on low heat for 12 minutes
Let soup cool down to room temperature
Blend soup with hand blender until smooth
Bring soup to the boil over high heat
Season soup lightly with 0.25 teaspoons of ground pepper
Preheat oven to 200 degrees celsius
Wash 2 large potatoes well with cold water and peel
Roughly slice washed potatoes into thick slices of 1 centimeter thickness
Peel 2 large fresh onions and slice finely into thick slices of 1 centimeter thickness
Rinse 6 leaves of fresh parsley well with cold running water
Cut off fat from 1 kilograms pork roast
Rub 1 tablespoons of olive oil evenly over pork roast
Sprinkle 0.25 teaspoons of salt and 0.5 teaspoons of ground pepper evenly over pork roast
Rinse 4 leaves of fresh sage well with cold running water
Place 20 slices of bacon stripes on to large roasting pan
Place oiled and spiced roast on to bacon
Place parsley on to roast
Place sage on to roast
Wrap pork roast with bacon
Add potato slices and onion slices to roasting pan
Transfer roasting pan to oven
Roast pork roast in the oven at 200 degrees celsius for 30 minutes
Take roasting pan out of oven
Let pork roast rest for 5 minutes
Finely slice bacon wrapped pork roast into thick slices of 2 centimeters thickness
Peel 100 grams fresh onions and chop finely
Peel 1 cloves of fresh garlic
Add 2 tablespoons of olive oil to medium-sized saucepan
Add 2 liters water to empty large saucepan and bring to the boil over medium heat
Add 1 teaspoons of salt and 200 grams spaghetti to water
Cook spaghetti on medium heat for 7 minutes
Mince garlic
Heat-up olive oil until hot
Add chopped onions and minced garlic to medium-sized saucepan with olive oil
Saut onions and garlic on medium heat until golden brown
Wash 2 grams basil with cold water
Add 300 grams tomato sauce to onions and garlic and bring to the boil over medium heat
Season sauce with 0.25 teaspoon of salt, 0.5 teaspoons of dried oregano and 0.25 teaspoons of ground pepper
Drain spaghetti with colander
Add drained spaghetti to sauce
Mix spaghetti and sauce until well combined
Sprinkle 50 grams grated mountain cheese and basil over spaghetti and sauce
Wash 200 grams yellow peppers with cold water and cut into halves lengthwise
Remove seeds from peppers
Slice peppers
Wash 1 stalks of leek with cold water and chop finely
Peel 200 grams red onions and slice
Add 2 tablespoons of olive oil to medium-sized saucepan and heat-up until hot
Add chopped leek and onion slices to saucepan
Saut leek and onion on medium heat until golden brown
Slice 150 grams fresh champignons
Add pepper slices, champignon slices and 300 grams tomato sauce to saucepan
Bring tomato sauce to the boil over medium heat
Keep sauce warm on lowest heat
Add 2 liters water to empty large saucepan and bring to the boil over medium heat
Add 1 teaspoons of salt and 200 grams spaghetti to water
Cook spaghetti on medium heat for 7 minutes
Season sauce with 0.25 teaspoon of salt, 0.5 teaspoons of dried oregano and 1 teaspoons of dried thyme
Wash 2 grams basil with cold water
Drain spaghetti with colander
Add drained spaghetti to sauce
Mix spaghetti and sauce until well combined
Sprinkle 50 grams grated mountain cheese and basil over spaghetti and sauce
Peel 100 grams fresh onions and chop finely
Peel 1 cloves of fresh garlic and mince
Add 2 tablespoons of olive oil to medium-sized saucepan and heat-up until hot
Add chopped onions and minced garlic to saucepan
Saut onions and garlic on medium heat until golden brown
Add 250 grams tomato sauce, 100 grams dried cherry tomatoes and 80 grams dried red peppers to onions and garlic
Bring sauce to the boil over medium heat
Keep tomato sauce warm on lowest heat
Add 2 liters water to empty large saucepan and bring to the boil over medium heat
Add 1 teaspoons of salt and 200 grams penne to water
Cook penne on medium heat for 7 minutes
Season sauce with 0.25 teaspoon of salt, 0.25 teaspoons of dried thyme and 0.25 teaspoons of ground pepper
Wash 2 grams basil with cold water
Drain penne with colander
Add drained penne to sauce
Mix penne until well combined
Sprinkle 50 grams grated mountain cheese and basil over penne
Add 300 milliliters whole milk to small saucepan and carefully heat-up until hot
Add 2 tablespoons of butter to empty medium-sized saucepan
Heat-up butter until melted
Add 3 teaspoons of wheat flour to medium-sized saucepan with butter
Mix wheat flour until well combined
Carefully stir in milk into wheat flour
Add 2 liters water to empty large saucepan and bring to the boil over medium heat
Add 1 teaspoons of salt and 200 grams spaghetti to water
Cook spaghetti on medium heat for 7 minutes
Cook sauce on low heat until thick
Drain spaghetti with colander
Chop 80 grams almonds
Wash 2 grams basil with cold water
Stir sauce every 30 seconds
Season sauce with 0.25 teaspoon of salt, 0.5 teaspoons of dried thyme and 0.25 teaspoons of ground pepper
Add drained spaghetti and chopped almonds to sauce
Add 60 grams dried red peppers to spaghetti and sauce
Mix spaghetti and sauce until well combined
Sprinkle 50 grams grated mountain cheese and basil over spaghetti and sauce
Crack open 3 chicken eggs into medium-sized bowl
Separate leaves of 0.5 handfuls of fresh coriander from stems
Rinse coriander leaves with cold running water until water runs clear
Drain coriander leaves
Finely chop coriander leaves
Peel 1 fresh onion and chop finely
Carefully heat 1.5 tablespoons of olive oil in medium-sized frying pan until hot
Wash 1 small fresh green chili pepper and chop finely
Add onions to hot olive oil
Add chili peppers to oil and onions and saut on high heat for 3 minutes
Wash 1 fresh tomato and chop finely
Add tomatoes to frying pan
Cook onion and tomato mix on medium heat for 5 minutes
Whisk eggs until frothy
Season onion and tomato mix with 0.5 teaspoons of salt, 0.5 teaspoons of garam masala and 1 pinches of chili powder
Season onion and tomato mix with 1 teaspoons of ground coriander
Saut onion, tomato and spice mix on medium heat for 1 minute
Add eggs to onion, tomato and spice mix and stir lightly for 5 minutes
Sprinkle fresh coriander leaves over egg mixture
Add 50 milliliters water to large saucepan
Separate leaves of 1 kilograms fresh spinach leaves from stems
Rinse spinach leaves gently with cold running water until water runs clear
Add spinach leaves to saucepan
Cover saucepan with lid and cook on medium heat for 7 minutes
Let spinach leaves cool down to room temperature
Puree spinach with blender
Peel 1 fresh onion and chop finely
Heat 1.5 tablespoons of ghee in large frying pan until hot
Add 1 teaspoons of cumin to frying pan
Cook cumin on medium heat until brown
Add onions to cumin
Cook onions on medium heat for 5 minutes
Add spinach to cumin and onions
Cook spinach on medium heat for 7 minutes
Cut 1 whole chicken into pieces of 7 centimeters side length
Add 1 teaspoons of ginger paste, 0.75 teaspoons of garlic paste and 1 teaspoons of ground coriander to spinach
Add 0.25 teaspoons of chili powder, 0.75 teaspoons of garam masala and 0.5 teaspoons of ground curcuma to spinach
Add 1 teaspoons of salt to spinach
Cook spinach with spices on medium heat for 1 minute
Gently stir in whole chicken pieces into spinach with spices
Gently stir in 150 grams plain curd into spinach with spices
Cover spinach and chicken mixture with lid and cook on medium heat for 15 minutes
Cut 0.75 kilograms lamb chops into big pieces
Carefully heat 1.5 tablespoons of ghee in large frying pan over medium heat until hot
Gently stir in chops into heated ghee
Cook chops on low heat for 10 minutes
Add 1 teaspoons of ground cumin, 1 teaspoons of ginger paste and 1 teaspoons of garlic paste to lamb
Add 0.75 teaspoons of Kashmiri chili powder, 1.5 teaspoons of ground coriander and 0.5 teaspoons of paprika powder to lamb
Add 0.75 teaspoons of garam masala and 1.25 teaspoons of salt to lamb

Add 200 grams plain curd to mutton and spice mixture
Cover mutton, spice and curd mixture with lid
Cook lamb on medium heat for 40 minutes
Wash 3 fresh tomatoes and chop finely
Peel 1 large onion and slice
Peel 100 grams carrots and cut into thin sticks of 3 centimeters length

Wash 150 grams cauliflower
Add 1 teaspoons of cumin to soy oil
Cook cumin on medium heat for 1 minute
Wash 50 grams green peppers
Add onions to cumin
Cook onions on medium heat for 5 minutes
Wash 50 grams fresh green beans
Roughly cut cauliflower into medium-sized pieces
Add tomatoes to cumin and onions
Cook tomatoes on medium heat for 5 minutes
Cut peppers into thin sticks of 3 centimeters length
Roughly cut green beans into pieces of 3 centimeters length

Add 1.5 teaspoons of ground coriander, 0.75 teaspoons of garam masala and 1.5 teaspoons of salt to onion and tomato mix

Add green beans, cauliflower and carrots to onion, tomato and spice mix
Add 100 grams peas and peppers to onion, tomato and spice mix
Cover frying pan with lid
Cook vegetables and spices on medium heat for 10 minutes

Gently heat 2 tablespoons of soy oil in medium-sized frying pan over medium heat until hot
Add 1 teaspoons of cumin to heated soy oil
Cook cumin on medium heat for 1 minute
Gently stir in onions into cumin
Cook onions on medium heat for 5 minutes
Wash 3 fresh tomatoes and chop finely
Add tomatoes to cumin and onions
Cook tomatoes on medium heat for 5 minutes
Peel 2 large potatoes and cut roughly into cubes of 2.5 centimeters thickness
Add 0.75 teaspoons of ground curcuma, 0.5 teaspoons of chili powder and 1 teaspoons of garam masala to onion and tomato mix
Add 1.5 teaspoons of ground coriander and 1.5 teaspoons of salt to onion and tomato mix
Cook onion, tomato and spice mix on medium heat for 2 minutes
Gently stir in potatoes into onion, tomato and spice mix

Cook potatoes and spices on medium heat for 5 minutes
Wash 2 large green peppers and cut roughly into pieces of 2.5 centimeters side length
Gently stir in peppers into onion, tomato and spice mix
Cover frying pan with lid and cook on medium heat for 15 minutes
Add 50 milliliters lemon juice to large bowl
Peel 50 grams fresh onions
Finely dice onions into cubes of 0.3 centimeters side length
Add onions to bowl
Wash 500 grams fresh tomatoes and cut into cubes of 0.5 centimeters side length
Add tomato cubes to bowl
Wash 3 bunches of fresh parsley
Drain parsley
Finely chop parsley
Add parsley and 100 milliliters olive oil to bowl
Sprinkle 50 grams bulgur over Tabbouleh
Season Tabbouleh with 1 pinches of salt
Mix Tabbouleh until well combined
Fill small saucepan with water
Add 6 chicken eggs to saucepan
Boil eggs for 15 minutes
Mince 1 scallion
Mince 3 cloves of fresh garlic
Rinse 1 kilograms pork bellies with water
Cut pork into cubes of 4 centimeters side length
Add 2 tablespoons of sunflower oil to medium-sized frying pan and heat-up until hot
Add minced garlic and minced scallions to frying pan
Stir garlic scallion mix for 30 seconds
Add pork and 1 teaspoons of ground pepper to frying pan
Stir-fry pork on medium heat for 6 minutes
Remove frying pan from heat
Transfer eggs to colander
Peel eggs
Set eggs aside
Add 150 grams white sugar to empty large saucepan and heat-up until caramelised
Stir white sugar for 1 minute
Add 100 milliliters water to caramel and stir until well combined
Add pork to caramel and stir until well combined
Add 5 deciliters water, 180 milliliters soy sauce and 1 tablespoons of fish sauce to large saucepan
Add 1 pinches of salt and eggs to large saucepan
Stir caramel soy sauce until well combined
Bring caramel soy sauce to the boil over medium heat
Cook caramelised pork on medium heat for 20 minutes
Remove large saucepan from heat
Sprinkle 1 pinch of pepper over caramelised pork
